intro: Astragalus prebblei, commonly known as the Prebble milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to drought conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor environments. Astragalus prebblei plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife in its native habitat.
